DOC.brief_summary: In a previous phase II study, the safety and efficacy of a novel formulation of malathion 0.5% was evaluated in patients 2 years of age and older. Based on the results of that study, this formulation is currently in a phase III study for that population. The current study will use blood markers and clinical evaluations to determine the safety and tolerability of this formulation when used in children 6-24 months of age.
DOC.brief_title: Safety and Tolerability of a Novel Malathion Formulation in Children Age 6-24 Months With Head Lice
DOC.criteria: Confirmed active head lice infestation Allergy to pediculicides or hair care products Scalp conditions other than head lice Previous head lice treatment within the past 4 weeks Current antibiotic treatment
